comments:
After the big commit about actions, getcfg no longer works ok...
Exceptions like this:

=== Problem running 'getcfg'...
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Errors during resolve
	at org.eclipse.buckminster.core.rmap.ResolveContext.resolve(ResolveContext.java:275)

Errors during resolve
[0.1]No component type with id eclipse.installed has been registered with extension-point org.eclipse.buckminster.core.componentTypes
[0.2]No component type with id eclipse.installed has been registered with extension-point org.eclipse.buckminster.core.componentTypes
[0.3]No component type with id eclipse.installed has been registered with extension-point org.eclipse.buckminster.core.componentTypes
[0.4]No component type with id eclipse.installed has been registered with extension-point org.eclipse.buckminster.core.componentTypes
[0.5]No component type with id eclipse.installed has been registered with extension-point org.eclipse.buckminster.core.componentTypes
[0.6]No component type with id eclipse.installed has been registered with extension-point org.eclipse.buckminster.core.componentTypes

The pde component has the eclipse.installed component type, but I can't figure out why it doesn't 'take'...??? Nothing in the workspace .log so it doesn't seem to be a bona fide plugin startup problem either...probably something simple - the search goes on...

I'm not able to reproduce this problem but some changes was made in this area very recently. A fresh workspace might be worth trying. Here's what's happened.

The eclipse.installed component type was previously called eclipse-installed. At present, both names are permitted although the latter should be considered deprecated. The same is true for eclipse-project (now eclipse.project) and buckminster-component (now just buckminster).

Our samples now uses the new name so an attempt to do getcfg with an old version of Buckminster would result in the errors that you are experiencing.

I ran this with a updated workspace, selfhosted and always starting with a clean workspace - so it should have been ok all over...

But, it *seems* the problem was related to the default launch configuration in terms of plugin selection - presumably because Eclipse somehow selected the installed buckminster pde rather than the workspace version (which makes little sense - why that but no other?). I fiddled with explicitly stating what plugins to use and then it started to work. However, reverting to the old settings...it still works...???

Oh well...seems to be in the category of 'selfhosted is not always comparable to a clean install'...
